subject: Re: Introduction
preview: Hi Andy,    I'd like to introduce you to David from our tech team, who I've looped in on this email.    We're currently reviewing our staging environment setup and would appreciate your help ensuring

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi Andy,

I'd like to introduce you to David from our tech team, who I've looped in on this email.

We're currently reviewing our staging environment setup and would appreciate your help ensuring he has all the information and access they need to properly assess it.

Could you please provide them with any relevant context, documentation, and access related to the current standalone staging environment, including anything specific to how it has been configured or used historically?

The goal is for the tech team to determine whether we need to keep this separate staging environment, or if we can instead rely on the staging site included with our current live hosting setup.

Thanks in advance for your support, and please let me know if you need anything from my side.
Andrea Bermudez

Head of Marketing

m 0415 881 835

e andrea.bermudez@stellainsurance.com.au

w stellainsurance.com.au

Hi Andy

Thanks for the update. I'll check in with our tech team and get back to you to confirm whether we need the separate environment.

One additional high-priority item is updating the FAQ section on a page I'm working on. As raised previously, the text in list grid components is disappearing again, which means I'm unable to update it myself.

If it's faster, could you please update the FAQs on my behalf so I can share them internally for approval? We can then address the underlying issue separately.

Below is the content for the FAQ section, and here is the template of the page I am working on:

Why choose Stella?

Stella is a purpose-driven insurance brand that is mission-led, authentically different and passionately pro-women. We are passionate about challenging the status quo, championing equality and building products for a fairer world.

At Stella, we prioritise the needs and lifestyles of women, adapting and tailoring product and experiences with you in mind. We want to empower customers and humanise insurance which is clearly no small challenge.

Beyond insurance, we partner with like-minded people and organisations creating a community to drive actionable change for women. A portion of our profits is given to women focused charities and organisations with a shared vision to help improve the lives of women. The world moves forward when we work together, as partners, allies, equals.

Is Stella for women only?

No, we are not for women only. We are a female-focused brand with a vision to balance the gender biases that exist for women. In saying that, we insure men and non-binary too and see ourselves as an inclusive community.

We have thousands of customers who are men and non-binary and are proud that our customers are supportive of our position to support and empower women.

What is life, income and home loan insurance?

Life insurance, income protection and home loan protection are designed to provide financial support if something unexpected happens. Each type of cover supports you in different ways, depending on what you want to protect.

How can I get life, income or home loan insurance?

You can get a quote online through Stella. When you're ready, you'll be taken through to the insurer's secure website to complete your quote and, if you choose, purchase your policy.

What does life, income and home loan insurance cover?

Cover depends on the type of insurance you choose.

Life insurance may provide a lump sum payment if you pass away or are diagnosed with a terminal illness.

Income protection may provide a monthly payment if you're unable to work due to sickness or injury.

Home loan protection may help cover your outstanding home loan balance or minimum repayments if something unexpected happens.

Always read the relevant Product Disclosure Statement for full details.

When should I consider life or income protection insurance?

Many people consider cover when their financial responsibilities change, such as buying a home, getting married, starting a family or becoming more reliant on their income.

The right time depends on your personal circumstances.

Am I eligible to purchase?

Eligibility depends on the type of cover and your individual circumstances. When you apply, you'll be asked questions to help determine whether the cover is right for you.

Is my information kept confidential?

Yes. Your personal information is handled in accordance with privacy laws and the insurer's privacy policy.

Who provides the insurance?

Life insurance, income protection and home loan protection are issued by Zurich Australia Limited.

What happens after I click "Get a quote"?

You'll be taken to Zurich's website to complete your quote and, if you choose, purchase your policy directly with them.

Can Stella help with claims?

Claims are managed by the insurer. Stella's role is to help you understand your options before you choose cover.

Thank you

Andrea Bermudez
Head of Marketing

m 0415 881 835

e andrea.bermudez@stellainsurance.com.au

w stellainsurance.com.au

Hi Andrea,

Thanks for your patience as we moved things forward.

Your Kinsta sub-account has been provisioned and is now active.

This gives you direct access to all five Stella properties (Stella AU, Stella Brokers, Stella Woman, withStella, and the AU Staging site). You can find the password here: Secure Link (please let us know once you have access)

On WordPress, we have confirmed that your email has "WordPress site administrator" permissions across these environments, providing you with full edit access as requested. Let us know if you need any help gaining access.

Lastly, on stella-au-staging, we've investigated this and found it was activated October 27, 2023 and was requested by Anita.
Here is the approved proposal, this was set up as a standalone environment for internal quoting purposes to avoid conflicts with the technical staging site. This has been downgraded to hosting only - Let us know if you'd like any further changes to this.

Our team is finalizing the plugin removal and disappearing text.

We will send you another update first thing tomorrow morning.

Thank you,
Andy

****

Hi Andy,

Thank you. I'll wait to receive access to the sub-account. Could you please confirm that this will give me edit access to all WordPress websites?

Also, could you please confirm the dates when you'll action the items I listed? As we're already in the second week of the month, I'd also appreciate confirmation that the header-tag audit won't be deducted from our allocated time.

Thank you,
Andrea Bermudez

Head of Marketing

e andrea.bermudez@stellainsurance.com.au

Kind regards

Victoria Smith

Managing Director

m 0467 723 135

w stellainsurance.com.au

Hi Andrea, Thanks for confirming the priorities and next steps. The accounts team have updated the 3x Essential care plans to hosting only: stellarinsurance.co.uk, stellawoman.co.uk, and withstellar.co.uk The kinsta account set-up does take some time and we should have your sub account ready for tomorrow. On the first priority for plugin maintenance. We've looked into and here are the details:
  • The Last Update Run was Dec 18, 2025 (Logged by Joel, 3 days after she started).
  • We operate on a monthly maintenance cycle (scheduled for the 2nd week of each month).
  • Between Dec 19 - Jan 14, developers released new versions of those plugins.
  • The "pending updates" she sees now are new versions that accumulated after our last round, not old ones we ignored.
  • We are currently in the scheduled January maintenance window.
Let me know if that is what you were expecting? Our team will get started investigating the Plugin removal now to ensure not going to impact the rest of the site. Thanks so much, Andy

Hi Andy,

Thank you for sharing the summary. I just want to clarify a few points and align on next steps.

First, could you please share a clear timeline for when the items below will be actioned? As mentioned earlier, nothing has been actioned since 15 December, when I started. Having clear deadlines will help manage expectations, especially as several of these items should not take a significant amount of time.

I'll be expecting items 1 and 2 below to be actioned today.

Regarding the technical work, I want to reiterate that any on-page SEO optimisation will be requested as specific tasks going forward. That said, ensuring headlines follow a correct hierarchical structure is part of standard on-page SEO and is included in our current plan. As this was not implemented correctly in previous work, I don't believe it should be deducted from our support hours and should be fixed by your team at no additional cost.

I've reordered the list below by priority and added a few missing tasks that I had previously requested. Please confirm when each of these will be actioned.

Priority tasks:



  1. Plugin maintenance: Clear the backlog of pending updates (currently 11 plugins).


  2. Plugin removal: Remove the plugins previously requested and migrate all redirections into RankMath.


  3. Troubleshooting: Resolve the "disappearing text" issue within Elementor containers, particularly on product listing pages.


  4. Code cleanup: Identify and remove redundant Elementor containers to improve load speed.


  5. Gutenberg transition: Deactivate the legacy Gutenberg plugin in a staging environment and replace any broken containers with modern Elementor equivalents.





  1. Header-tag audit: Correct the header hierarchy across all pages for SEO compliance. As noted above, this should not be deducted from our allocated time. Please ensure there is only one H1 per page. If there is a tagline under the H1, it should be formatted as a paragraph, not a heading. Any subsequent section headings should be H2, with headings under those sections set as H3 where applicable. Please let me know if you have any questions about this.



Looking forward to your confirmation on timelines so we can move forward.

Andrea Bermudez
Head of Marketing

m 0415 881 835

e andrea.bermudez@stellainsurance.com.au

w stellainsurance.com.au

Hi Andrea, Thank you for the call earlier today. Helpful to align on the priorities for restructuring and optimizations for the Stella Australia site. We're happy to provide granular "per-task" time tracking reports for the next two months and will ensure you're on the monthly reporting schedule. We should be able to get 1 and 2 done tomorrow before proceeding to 3 (optimization tasks). For the header tags: there are ~50 unique pages and ~200 posts using a similar template. Reviewing the unique ones and the template will take ~2 hours assuming 2-3 minutes per page. Let us know if you'd like us to proceed with this (or if the other technical items are higher priority). Thank you, Andy *** Priorities 1. Financial & Billing Restructuring
  • Plan Migrations: Downgrading stellarinsurance.co.uk, stellawoman.co.uk, and withstellar.co.uk to the $50/mo Hosting-only plan.
  • Staging Investigation: Reviewing the stella-au-staging setup to determine why it is currently functioning as a standalone site rather than a standard replica, with the goal of rectifying the billing and functionality.
2. Access & Security
  • Kinsta Access: Provisioning a new sub-account to give you direct access to all Stella properties.
  • Contact Management: Updating records to include Stephen Taylor as the primary contact for the UK entities.
3. Technical & SEO Optimization (Stella Australia)
  1. Header-Tag Audit: Correcting the header hierarchy across all pages for SEO compliance.
  2. Code Cleanup: Identifying and removing redundant Elementor containers to improve load speeds.
  3. Plugin Maintenance: Clearing the backlog of pending updates (7+ plugins).
  4. Gutenberg Transition: Deactivating the legacy Gutenberg plugin on a staging environment and replacing broken containers with modern Elementor equivalents.
  5. Troubleshooting: Resolving the "disappearing text" issue within Elementor containers.

Thanks and speak then!

Thank you, Allie.

Let's keep the PublishPress Revisions plugin on the staging website for now.

On another note, could you please grant me access to everything related to the Stella Brokers website, including WordPress admin access and hosting access?

We're also reviewing the invoices we receive from you and would like some clarification. Is Andy the best person to speak with about this? So we can talk about this during our meeting tomorrow.

Thank you.
Andrea Bermudez

Head of Marketing

Hi Andrea,

Thanks so much for your reply.

I’ve outlined our responses below for clarity, happy to talk through anything further if helpful.

Sincerely,
Allie

***
Support Time Tracking
  • That works perfectly for us. Going forward, we’ll keep you informed once each job is completed.
    We’ll include:
    • How much time was used for the task
    • How much time remains in your monthly allocation
  • If we notice that you’re getting close to using all allocated minutes, we’ll proactively flag this so there are no surprises.

PublishPress Revisions
  • If revisions are handled via the staging site, the plugin isn’t strictly required.
  • We initially suggested keeping it because it provides:
    • Draft and revision visibility
    • A central dashboard to review content changes
    • Helpful auditing and troubleshooting capabilities if something breaks
  • That said, we’re very happy to proceed with removing it entirely (including on staging) if you prefer, just let us know.

Staging Indexing
  • Confirming that the staging website is set to noindex and is not indexed by search engines.

We’ll proceed based on your preferences and keep you informed along the way.

Thanks Allie, I'm also looking forward to the call.

Regarding support time tracking, it would be enough for me if you could keep me informed once jobs are completed. Please include how much time was used and how much time remains. It would also be helpful to know if we are getting close to using all the allocated minutes.

Thank you for everything else. I just have one last clarification about the PublishPress Revisions plugin. If we use the staging website for revisions, we should not need this plugin at all. Based on that, I do not think we would need it on staging either. Please let me know if there is a reason you have suggested keeping it.

And can you please confirm the staging website is not indexed.

Kind regards,
Andrea Bermudez

Head of Marketing

Hi Andrea,

Thank you for getting back to us, and perfect, Tuesday at 2:30 pm works well on our end. We’re looking forward to the discussion, and Andy will be leading the call.

I’ve added our responses below. Please feel free to share any feedback or questions.

Sincerely,
Allie
****
Support Time Tracking
  • At this stage, we’re unable to provide direct access to HelpScout, as it contains time tracking data across multiple clients.
  • That said, we’re more than happy to keep you updated on your remaining balance at any time, just let us know and we can provide this promptly.

Maintenance and Updates
  • We’ll proceed with deleting any inactive plugins.
  • Moving forward, we’ll ensure inactive plugins are not kept on the website.

Plugins
  • Classic Editor
    • We’ll carefully test removing this plugin and ensure nothing breaks. If any issues arise, we’ll replace it with a safer alternative.
    • Rest assured, it will be fully removed as soon as it’s safe to do so.
  • Enable Media Replace
    • Understood. We’ll proceed with removing this plugin now.
  • PublishPress Revisions
    • Yes, we’ll remove it from the live site and ensure it remains available on staging instead.

We’ll run the necessary tests and handle these updates carefully, and we’ll keep you informed along the way.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hello Ally,

Thanks for the prompt response, Tuesday at 2.30 pm works for me, thank you.

Please see my responses to the previous questions below:

Support Time Tracking
Is it possible to get access to HelpScout so we can see the remaining balance in real time?

Maintenance and Updates
Yes, please delete any inactive plugins. Going forward, we don't want inactive plugins kept on the website.

Plugins



  • Classic Editor: Please test removing this plugin until nothing breaks. If anything breaks, replace it with a new container. This plugin keeps WordPress in the old version and is only a short-term workaround. Over time, it increases technical debt, limits new features, and makes future updates harder and more expensive.


  • Enable Media Replace: We can remove this. If the file is the same format and has the same name, it automatically replaces the old one, this is how I've been managing it.


  • PublishPress Revisions: Can we use the staging site instead?



Thanks, and looking forward to speaking on Tuesday.

Andrea Bermudez
Head of Marketing

m 0415 881 835

e andrea.bermudez@stellainsurance.com.au

w stellainsurance.com.au

Hi Andrea,

Happy Friday and thanks for your patience.

Looping in @andy to meet with you. Does Monday at 11am or Tuesday at 230pm work.

Secondly, I've put answer to your questions below and welcome any feedback.

Thanks,
Ally

*****

Support Time Tracking
  • We utilize HelpScout as the system of truth for all tasks and time. Time spent on every ticket is tracked
  • Attached is a CSV of the support requests for the last 12 months.

Maintenance and Updates
  • We perform updates in controlled batches to ensure plugin compatibility and site stability, rather than auto-updating immediately which carries security and breakage risks.
  • As we co-pilot websites with customers, we don't delete plugins unless requested or present security risk
  • We are happy to audit and remove inactive plugins during this week's maintenance round to adhere to best practices.

Redirects
  • No problems, we will proceed with migrating redirects to RankMath.
  • This typically requires 15–30 minutes depending on the volume of rules.

SEO Ownership
  • Noted - we will stand by for your direction.

Hosting and CDN Pricing
  • Our Care Plans are a bundled service rather than a line-item breakdown.
  • The $259/month covers high-performance Google Cloud hosting, Enterprise CDN, daily backups, security scanning, and the 2 hours of engineering time.
  • The raw underlying hosting and CDN costs are probably ~$50 , with the remainder for everything else

Plugins (Technical Rationale)
  • Classic Editor: We keep this for compatibility with legacy page sections that do not render correctly in Gutenberg. We will test removing it; if the layout holds, we will delete it.
  • Enable Media Replace: We recommend keeping this. Deleting and re-uploading a file changes the image ID in the database, which often breaks links across the site. This plugin allows us to update assets safely without breaking front-end visuals.
  • PublishPress Revisions: This is used to stage content updates and manage editorial approvals without publishing live immediately. It is critical for maintaining compliance on regulated sites before changes go public.
  • Yoast Duplicate Post: We will remove this as requested and utilize Elementor templates for duplication moving forward.

Analytics
  • There is an existing Google tag on the site that wasn’t set up by our team, and we don’t currently have access to it. To avoid disrupting existing data, we haven’t modified it.
  • If you can confirm whether you still have access, or would like us to create and manage a new GA4 setup, we’re happy to proceed and send you an invite once complete.
